title: For £1,000-a-month you can go to the loo in your bedroom
text:
Open plan toilets could be next year’s hot new thing

Have you ever wanted to roll out of bed and land straight on the toilet?

Well, if the answer is yes, you might want to consider moving to Brighton.

There is a one-bedroom flat on the market for £1000-a-month, and it’s just a stone’s throw from the station.

The only catch is that people might think you’re a serial killer.

Alice Tew shared pictures of the Rightmove listing on Twitter, writing: ‘Imagine getting back to someone’s house to find this set up.’

The unique flat is now being mercilessly mocked online, and most of the humour is being directed at the open-plan en-suite.

The mirrors make it look even more spacious

One person wrote: ‘Given the amount of mirrors, I’m guessing they’re two-way so the landlord can watch this suffering room.’

Dave Skinner joked: ‘I’m wondering if the rug is actually a trapdoor concealing the stairs.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Another joined in on the fun: ‘That’s where they had to cut out the huge bloodstain.’

It seems prospective tenants have to enter the flat’s only bedroom through the wet room, which comes complete with a rainforest shower.

The boundary of the bright blue bathroom flooring ends just after the toilet, where the grey carpet of the bedroom begins.

However, the easy access to the toilet is being seen as a positive by some.

Yes, that is a rainforest shower you see in the distance

Lex Guerrilla wrote: ‘Open plan toilet is the new thing.’

Alex McCall said ‘it’s really not all that bad’.

He joked: ‘I don’t know why everyone is complaining.

‘After you’ve had a heavy bowel movement and filled the room with steam from your shower, you can go to bed knowing you’ll quietly asphyxiate in your sleep.

‘People really need to see the big picture here.’

The flat is just a stone’s throw from the station

Some suggested it could have originally been set-up for a disabled tenant, while others said it looks like ‘a prison cell with carpeting’.

The lower-ground floor flat is being let by estate agents Mishon Mackay, but the listing has since been removed from Rightmove.

In the online description, the agent wrote: ‘The bedroom is a fantastic size having double glazed window to front and en-suite wet room area.

‘”Location, location, location” is something that will spring to mind when viewing this property, Western Road and the shopping mall are located within half a mile.

‘For the commuters out there Brighton mainline train station is located at the bottom of the road.’
